common_issues.title: Ollama Integration Issues with Pieces OS
common_issues.description: Users report difficulties installing and running Ollama, both locally and through Pieces OS. Problems include installation failures, CUDA errors, and conflicts between Pieces OS and external Ollama instances. Proposed solutions involve reinstalling Ollama and Pieces OS, verifying paths, and analyzing log files. Further investigation and troubleshooting are often required.

related_issues.title: Installing Ollama - Forever
related_issues.text:
Installing Ollama - Forever
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/677e938c-3198-4f1b-af00-b22543704fcc)

I have Ollama installed and this is stuck like this forever. I even tried uninstalling Ollama. Still the same :-(
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User waseem852 is facing issues while installing Ollama.
* They have tried various methods: through Pieces, winget, and manual installation, but all resulted in the same error.
* They have also tried restarting Pieces OS and Desktop applications and killing them through Task Manager.

**Problems Identified:**

* Ollama installation fails regardless of the method used.
* The exact error message is not provided in the conversation.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Brian-at-pieces suggests scheduling a call with waseem852 to debug the issue further.
* Waseem852 agrees to the call.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The conversation ends with Brian-at-pieces inviting waseem852 for a call to diagnose the issue further.
* The outcome of the call and the resolution of the problem are not mentioned in the provided conversation.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user mentions trying with "Pieces" and with "set up and tried with Pieces". It is unclear if these are the same method or two different methods.
* The specific version of Pieces OS and Ollama used are not mentioned in the conversation.

**Recommendations:**

* To get a complete picture of the issue and its resolution, reviewing the entire conversation and any follow-up comments or updates would be helpful.
* If the issue remains unresolved, providing more details about the specific error message and the versions of Pieces OS and Ollama used would facilitate further troubleshooting.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces OS instance's Ollama server would always give errors regarding various Cuda dll files not being registered or not found, so I then installed Ollama server from its source which works and Pieces OS could also connect too and use, the problem I'm facing now is that Pieces OS on startup seems to keep starting its own Ollama instance rather than using the externally installed Ollama server instance which means I see the Cuda dll errors again.  My workaround is that I must quit Pieces OS completely then start Ollama server from its own shortcut then start Pieces OS??

Any Ideas??
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Title:** Ollama Server crashing on startup in PiecesOS

**Key points raised:**

* Ollama server crashes on startup when installed through PiecesOS but works fine when installed separately.
* User suspects Cuda related issue with the included Ollama version in PiecesOS.
* Conflicting startup order with PiecesOS and the external Ollama instance.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Clean uninstall and reinstall of Ollama and PiecesOS.
* Path cleanup to ensure the correct Ollama executable is used.
* Detection of external Ollama instance implemented in PiecesOS version 11.1.2.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue is resolved for the user after multiple reinstalls and path cleanup, but the cause remains unclear.
* Potential fix implemented in PiecesOS 11.1.2 to address race condition causing the crash.
* User requested further clarification on external Ollama instance detection and prevention of automatic Ollama installation.

**Additional notes:**

* The issue seems to be related to the user's specific setup and timing of startup processes.
* Further investigation and testing are needed to confirm the root cause and ensure a permanent solution.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## Issue Summary

**Key Points:**

* User @rohanrathi99 reported trouble making requests to Pieces cloud services and with local models. 
* Support agent @mark-at-pieces requested log files for further investigation.
* User uploaded log files and granted access for review.
* Initial log analysis revealed no apparent issues.
* A meeting was scheduled for further troubleshooting.

**Problems Identified:**

* User unable to make requests to Pieces cloud services and experiencing problems with local models.
* Root cause of the issue remained unclear after initial log review.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Log files were requested and analyzed.
* A meeting was scheduled for further troubleshooting.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is still under investigation. 
* A meeting is scheduled for February 25th to delve deeper into the problem. 
* No solution has been implemented yet. 

**Additional Notes:**

* The user provided a link to a shared folder containing the log files.
* The user scheduled a meeting for February 25th at 22:30.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop Application Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users are reporting issues with the Pieces Desktop application failing to launch or connect to services on different operating systems (Windows and Linux). Common troubleshooting steps include checking log files, verifying internet connectivity, and scheduling meetings for further investigation.

related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Support agent requested log files to diagnose the issue.
* No solution has been implemented yet.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Agent mark-at-pieces likely hasn't received the log files.
* Issue remains unresolved.

**Additional Notes:**

* The timestamps show a delay in responses from the user.
* The user's repeated requests for a fix suggest frustration and urgency.

related_issues.title: Invalid port http://0.0.0.0:null/connect
related_issues.text:
Invalid port http://0.0.0.0:null/connect
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.8 2025-02-17

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces for Developers hangs on first run in third step (Verify Dependency Connections) with error message

unable to open Pieces Core Services
formatexception: Invalid port (at character 16)
http://0.0.0.0:null/connect

Pieces OS seems to work fine, for a brief moment I can see its window with information that the service is active on some port. Then window closes - it is impossible to bring it back, but icon in the  system tray is still there.

How can I set proper port value for Pieces for Developer, and what is the default port value?
## Summary of GitHub issue conversation:

**Key points raised:**

* User mariusz-kowalski reported an issue with the Pieces Desktop App.
* The issue might be related to specific Linux machines.
* The support team requests log files and a video call for further troubleshooting.

**Problems identified:**

* The user is experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop App.
* The exact cause of the issue is unknown.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* The support team suggests checking related issues and resources.
* They also request log files and offer a video call for troubleshooting.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The user has provided the log file.
* They are unable to join a live session.

**Next steps:**

* The support team will analyze the log file to identify the cause of the issue. 
* They will then suggest further solutions or reach out to the user for additional information.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App Functionality Issues
common_issues.description: Users report problems with Pieces Desktop app, including account linking errors, cloud service connection failures, and application launch failures. Troubleshooting often involves analyzing log files and, in some cases, scheduling consultations for further assistance. Solutions are pending for several users.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of the GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Johnkennyuk (user) encountered an issue linking his GitHub and Google accounts on Pieces.
* Mark-at-pieces (Pieces staff member) acknowledged the problem and informed Johnkennyuk of a planned update to the linking flow.
* Mark-at-pieces offered to manually merge Johnkennyuk's accounts and guide him through the linking process.
* Johnkennyuk preferred a resolution via GitHub and had difficulty linking his accounts due to a capitalization discrepancy in his email addresses.
* Johnkennyuk requested an ETA on the new linking system and confirmed his interest in being an early adopter.

**Problems Identified:**

* The existing account linking flow was "not up to par" and "not straightforward."
* Johnkennyuk's accounts were registered separately due to a historical bug in the authentication process.
* A minor inconsistency in email capitalization caused the linking issue.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces proposed a manual account merge and guided Johnkennyuk through the linking process.
* Johnkennyuk's GitHub account was reset to attempt the linking process again.
* Temporarily disabling email privacy settings on GitHub was suggested as a potential solution.
* Mark-at-pieces informed Johnkennyuk of a new linking system in development, scheduled to be released in early/mid-March 2025.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The new linking system is under development with an estimated release date in early/mid-March 2025.
* Johnkennyuk agreed to wait for the new system, expressing interest in being an early adopter.
* The issue remains open awaiting the release and implementation of the new linking system.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation highlights the challenges associated with email-based authentication, especially when capitalization inconsistencies arise.
* The upcoming release of the new system is expected to resolve these issues and provide a more seamless and robust account linking experience.

common_issues.title: Pieces for Developers - Functionality Issues
common_issues.description: Users are reporting various issues with Pieces for Developers, including problems with horizontal scrolling, cursor behavior, and cloud service connectivity. Troubleshooting steps include checking internet connection, switching networks, and providing log files to the support team. Solutions are being investigated and implemented in future releases.

related_issues.title: Horizontal scrolling doesn't work in JetbRains plugin
related_issues.text:
Horizontal scrolling doesn't work in JetbRains plugin
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, JetBrains

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Horizontal scroll within a code snippet from copilot answer is buggy. I cannot scroll horizontally back and forth to see full line. I need to select text to reach end of line. Once release, my cursor wont appear to scroll left again. Horizontal scrollbar doesn't respond and I cannot select text to left. cursor changes to a drag and drop cursor.
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Issue:** Cursor not moving when typing in the Copilot chat window.

**Key Points:**

- The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the Pieces team.
- The user was provided with helpful resources, including similar issues, documentation, and support channels.
- Team members (@mack-at-pieces and @sam-p-at-pieces) were added to assist with the issue.

**Problems Identified:**

- The cursor doesn't move when typing in the Copilot chat window, making it difficult to edit text.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

- The team will investigate the issue and aim to fix it for an upcoming release.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

- The issue is being investigated and will be updated as progress is made.

related_issues.title: Cursor will not hide when typing in the Copilot chat window
related_issues.text:
Cursor will not hide when typing in the Copilot chat window
### Checked for Existing Issues?

### Your Pieces OS Version

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When initially beginning to type a question in the text field in Copilot, the mouse cursor/pointer will not hide and obstructs the text. I can't capture it in a screenshot, but the attachment should hopefully show a brief screen recording of the issue.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2e4e60bb-a8a2-49cd-92a5-35a49b2a63db
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points:**

* User `GeoMod` reported an issue regarding expected behavior in the Pieces app. 
* The Pieces support bot triaged the issue and assigned it to the appropriate team member.
* Support agent `mark-at-pieces` acknowledged the issue and assigned it to `mack-at-pieces` for further investigation.
* `mack-at-pieces` confirmed understanding the issue and expressed intent to address it in a future release.

**Problems Identified:**

* User `GeoMod` encountered an issue with the app's behavior not meeting their expectations. 
* The specific problem is not explicitly described in the conversation.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces team acknowledged the issue and committed to addressing it in a future release. 
* The specific solution is not yet implemented.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is currently under investigation by the Pieces team.
* A solution is expected to be implemented in a future release.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation does not provide details about the specific problem encountered by the user.
* The timeframe for implementing a solution is not specified.

recommendations: **Prioritize Ollama Integration Issues:** Allocate additional resources to investigate and resolve the recurring issue of Ollama integration problems with Pieces OS. This includes improving installation instructions, addressing CUDA errors, and ensuring compatibility between Pieces OS and external Ollama instances.

**Investigate Pieces Desktop Application Launch Failures:** Address the root cause of Pieces Desktop application launch failures on both Windows and Linux. Analyze log files, identify common error patterns, and provide clear troubleshooting steps for users.

**Improve Account Linking in Pieces Desktop App:** Review and enhance the account linking process in the Pieces Desktop app to ensure seamless integration with Google and GitHub accounts. Investigate and resolve any historical bugs or inconsistencies in the authentication process.

**Address Pieces for Developers Functionality Issues:** Dedicate resources to address the reported issues with Pieces for Developers, including horizontal scrolling problems, cursor behavior, and cloud service connectivity. Prioritize fixes for these issues in upcoming releases.

**Proactive Support and Communication:**  Implement a system for proactively monitoring and identifying potential issues based on user feedback and support tickets. Provide timely updates and communication to users regarding known issues, workarounds, and expected resolution times.

**Enhance Documentation and Troubleshooting Guides:** Update and expand the existing documentation and troubleshooting guides to cover the common issues identified, including Ollama integration problems, application launch failures, and account linking errors. Provide clear, step-by-step instructions and helpful screenshots or videos.

**Gather Detailed System Information:**  Develop a standardized process for collecting detailed system information from users experiencing issues. This includes operating system version, Pieces OS version, application logs, and any relevant error messages. This will help in faster diagnosis and resolution of problems.

**Consider Automated Troubleshooting Tools:** Explore the possibility of developing automated troubleshooting tools or scripts that can help users diagnose and resolve common issues without needing to contact support. This could include checking system requirements, verifying internet connectivity, or resetting application settings.
